Uses of Package
peregrine.annotations

Packages that use peregrine.annotations
peregrine.config Contains the configuration backend for peregrine and all associated classes; The API needs to pass Config objects within the system and this is the main way of obtaining them. 
peregrine.controller.rpcd RPC entry point for the controller. 
peregrine.controller.rpcd.delegate RPC delegates for the controller. 
peregrine.io.storage Metadata about files created on the local filesystem for usage by the controller to look for data imbalances with shuffle, data, balance data base on disk usages, and to help sysadmins and developers understand file system distribution within the cluster. 
peregrine.worker.rpcd.delegate   
 

Classes in peregrine.annotations used by peregrine.config
RPCMessage
          This object is designed to be serialized for use with our RPC framework.
VisibleForRPC
          This annotation marks a method as used ONLY for RPC and not part of the main API.
 

Classes in peregrine.annotations used by peregrine.controller.rpcd
RPC
          Tag annotation so that we can mark methods that exist just for RPC calls/endpoints
 

Classes in peregrine.annotations used by peregrine.controller.rpcd.delegate
RPC
          Tag annotation so that we can mark methods that exist just for RPC calls/endpoints
 

Classes in peregrine.annotations used by peregrine.io.storage
RPCMessage
          This object is designed to be serialized for use with our RPC framework.
VisibleForRPC
          This annotation marks a method as used ONLY for RPC and not part of the main API.
 

Classes in peregrine.annotations used by peregrine.worker.rpcd.delegate
RPC
          Tag annotation so that we can mark methods that exist just for RPC calls/endpoints
